subject: Online English/Latin to Quikscript transliteration
msgSnippet: Hi fans of Quikscript, I decided that I need some reading material in Quikscript and since I spend half my life reading things on the Internet, I made myself a
messageBody:
Hi fans of Quikscript,
I decided that I need some reading material in Quikscript and since I
spend half my life reading things on the Internet, I made myself a
little filter that turns English spelled with the Latin alphabet into
Quikscript. It's online now for everybody to use:
http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~robertw/QS/
The transliteration uses the dictionary found on the 'files' section
of our group. It has lots of bugs and sharp edges, but I wanted to see
if anybody likes the principle of it before I spend more time
improving it.
Can anybody tell me what the copyright status of the fonts from this
group's file section is? Can I offer one of the fonts for download on
the transliterator's web page, so that people can use the
transliterator without going to the Yahoo group first?
cheers & have fun,
Jack

Hi fans of Quikscript,
I decided that I need some reading material in Quikscript and since I
spend half my life reading things on the Internet, I made myself a
little filter that turns English spelled with the Latin alphabet into
Quikscript. It's online now for everybody to use:
http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~robertw/QS/
The transliteration uses the dictionary found on the 'files' section
of our group. It has lots of bugs and sharp edges, but I wanted to see
if anybody likes the principle of it before I spend more time
improving it.
Can anybody tell me what the copyright status of the fonts from this
group's file section is? Can I offer one of the fonts for download on
the transliterator's web page, so that people can use the
transliterator without going to the Yahoo group first?
cheers & have fun,
Jack
